subject: Re: JUnit3.7 Error message
msgSnippet: At my company we deploy patch jars (i.e. jars with only the class files that correspond to source code that has changed) to our customers.  We ve been burned

At my company we deploy patch jars (i.e. jars with only the class
files that correspond to source code that has changed) to our
customers.  We've been burned in doing this but it's offered some
useful learning experiences :)  The particular error you are seeing
comes from compiling against a JUnit jar in which the Assert class
contains an assert method that wasn't declared static.  But when you
run you're testcase you're using a different version of the JUnit.jar
in which the Assert class' assert method *is* declared static.  The
solution is to make sure that the JUnit.jar file in the CLASSPATH is
exactly the same for both compiling and running your testcase.

Rob Manning 


--- In junit@y..., "Pankaj Solanki" <psolanki@p...> wrote:
> Hi all,
> 
> Will any of you plz assess, why my SimpleTest.java file is failing :
>   
> The problem I am facing is:
> 
> When I compile a junit test file thru' VisualCafe4.0, it gets
compiled without any error.
> Later while invoking the TestRunner utility from console (any
approach - textui, awtui or swingui),
> I am getting following error message:
>  
> java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError: junit.framework.Assert:
method assert(Ljava/lang/String;Z)V did not used to be static
> 
>  at junit.samples.SimpleTest.testAdd(SimpleTest.java:32)
>  
> But surprisingly if I compile the same file from console and run the
TestRunner utility then test passes without any error and it show a
green bar. Perfect run.
> 
> My VisualCafe4.0 setting is fine (junit.jar and the directory which
contain this jar file is included in the classpath of sc.ini file). 
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> Pankaj
